message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about how a refrigerator operates. A refrigerator requires an electrical outlet to work because it relies on electricity to power the compressor and cooling system. Option (B) is incorrect because an ice maker is not necessary for a refrigerator to function, although many refrigerators do have ice makers as a feature. Option (C) is incorrect because a refrigerator does not rely on AA batteries for power. Option (D) is incorrect because a crisper is a compartment within a refrigerator used to keep fruits and vegetables fresh, but it is not necessary for the overall functioning of the refrigerator.

This question requires some basic knowledge about how a refrigerator operates. A refrigerator requires an electrical outlet to work because it uses electricity to power its compressor and other components. Option (B) is incorrect because not all refrigerators have ice makers and they can still function without one. Option (C) is incorrect because AA batteries are not typically used to power refrigerators. Option (D) is incorrect because a crisper is a specific compartment within a refrigerator used to store produce and is not necessary for the overall functioning of the appliance.
